snippet: Lawyers for Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, who faces federal terrorism charges, said on Friday that prison officials had not yet accommodated his many medical needs, including new prosthetic devices for his arms.
abstract: Lawyers for Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, Islamic preacher jailed in Manhattan since his extradition from Britain on federal terrorism charges, assail prison officials, saying they have not yet accommodated his disabilities, including replacement prosthetic devices for his arms; Manhattan Correctional Center officials require Mostafa to remove hooks that he wears as prosthetic devices whenever he is out of his cell, for safety reasons.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Mostafa Kamel Mostafa, who faces federal terrorism charges, said on Friday that prison officials had not yet accommodated his many medical needs, including new prosthetic devices for his arms.

headline.seo: Disabled Preacher in Terror Case Isn’t Treated Well, Lawyers Say
headline.main: U.S. Assailed on Treatment of Preacher From Britain
headline.print_headline: U.S. Assailed On Treatment Of Preacher From Britain
